Simulated Data: the Longitudinal Study of Australian Children (LSAC) — LSACdata
text: data.frame 5,107 rows, containing following variables: sep binary exposure variable fam_stress binary intermediate confounder parent_mh binary mediator preschool_att binary mediator child_mh binary outcome variable child_sex: binary baseline confounder child_atsi binary baseline confounder mat_cob binary baseline confounder mat_engl binary baseline confounder mat_age binary baseline confounder

text: Counterfactual Prediction Random Draw

title: Counterfactual Prediction and Random Draw — cf_predict
Counterfactual Prediction and Random Draw — cf_predict
text: fit fitted glm model object data data.table containing data counterfactual predictions applied. var_name character string specifying name variable store random draws. n integer specifying number observations dataset. family character string specifying distribution family use generating random draws. Must either "binomial" "gaussian".

what: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
title: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
text: Estimation Conditionals Mediators Exposed

title: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
code: con_exposed(MM, k, K, data, dat2, fam_type, interactions_XC, lnzero, n)

title: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
text: MM integer specifying index mediator whose distribution shifted. k integer specifying index current mediator processed. K integer specifying total number mediators intermediate confounders. data data.frame containing dataset analysis. dataset used fit model mediators. dat2 data.frame used perform counterfactual predictions random draws. fam_type character string specifying family type modeling. Options typically include "gaussian" continuous variables "binomial" binary variables. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. lnzero numeric vector specifying non-zero levels exposure. n integer specifying number observations dat2.

what: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type

title: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
text: data data.frame containing variables analyzed. variable_names character vector specifying names variables evaluate. variable name correspond column data.frame. unique_threshold integer value specifying minimum number unique values required variable classified continuous. Defaults 10.

title: Determine Appropriate Family Types for GLM — family_type
text: list element corresponds variable variable_names, value indicates family type: either "binomial()" binary variables "gaussian()" continuous variables.

what: Generate Model Formula for Mediator Models — gen_formula
title: Generate Model Formula for Mediator Models — gen_formula
text: function generates model formula mediator models based input parameters.

title: Generate Model Formula for Mediator Models — gen_formula
code: gen_formula(   k,   first = NULL,   MM = NULL,   K = NULL,   interactions_XC,   include_all = FALSE,   marginal = FALSE )

title: Generate Model Formula for Mediator Models — gen_formula
text: k integer specifying index mediator formula generated. first integer (optional) specifying index first mediator. Defaults NULL, indicating function generate formulas without explicitly considering parameter. MM integer (optional) specifying index mediator whose distribution shifted. Defaults NULL, indicating function generate formulas without explicitly considering parameter. K integer (optional) specifying total number mediators intermediate confounders. Defaults NULL, indicating function generate formulas without explicitly considering parameter. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. include_all Logical. marginal Logical. TRUE, estimating marginals X=0.

what: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
text: function performs actual causal mediation analysis estimate interventional effects mapped hypothetical target trial.

title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
code: medRCT.fun(   dat,   ind = 1:nrow(dat),   first = first,   K = K,   fam_type = fam_type,   interactions_XC = interactions_XC,   intervention_type = intervention_type,   mcsim )

title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. ind vector indices specifying subset dat use analysis. Defaults rows dat. parameter particularly useful using function within boot() function boot package, enables resampling specifying subsets data. first integer specifying index first mediator interest combined list intermediate confounders mediators. K integer specifying total number mediators intermediate confounders. Mediators considered sequentially based order. fam_type character string specifying family type modeling. Options typically include "gaussian" continuous variables "binomial" binary variables. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed accounting flow-effects causal descendent mediators. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform.

what: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
title: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
text: 'medRCT' used estimate interventional effects mapping observational data hypothetical target trial. can handle multiple mediators, including primary interest exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders.

title: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
code: medRCT(   dat,   exposure,   outcome,   mediators,   intermediate_confs,   confounders,   interactions_XC = "all",   intervention_type = c("all", "shift_all", "shift_k", "shift_k_order"),   mcsim,   bootstrap = TRUE,   boot_args = list(R = 100, stype = "i", ci.type = "norm"),   ... )

title: Causal mediation analysis for estimating the interventional effect — medRCT
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. include variables exposure, outcome, mediators, confounders, exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders specified analysis. exposure character string specifying name exposure variable dataset. exposure variable can categorical, 0 explicitly denoting unexposed (control) group. values represent different exposure categories. outcome character string specifying name outcome variable dataset. outcome variable can specified either binary continuous. mediators character vector specifying names mediator variables dataset. mediators can specified either binary continuous. estimating effect type "shift_k_order", order mediators vector important, determines causal sequence mediators. intermediate_confs character vector specifying names intermediate confounders dataset. intermediate confounders can specified either binary continuous. NULL, intermediate confounders specified, natural effect estimated. confounders character vector listing names baseline confounders. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed accounting flow-effects causally descendent mediators. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform. bootstrap logical value indicating whether bootstrapping performed. TRUE (default), bootstrapping conducted using boot function boot package. boot_args list arguments bootstrapping. default settings : R: Number bootstrap replicates (default: 100). stype: Specifies statistic type passed boot function (default: ""). ci.type: Specifies type confidence interval compute (default: "norm"). ... Additional arguments passed boot function boot package.
